column1: L, West Coast Cookbook & Speakeasy Daily Special River City Hash Mondays, justiceputnam, 2021-06-28, West Coast Cookbook & Speakeasy is Now Open! 8am-9am PT/ 11am-Noon ET for our especially special Daily Specials
column2: River City Hash Mondays!  Starting off in the Bistro Cafe a structural engineer explains what he discovered in the film footage and earlier reports of the Surfside condo collapse.  Then on the rest of the menu background checks blocked a record high three hundred thousand gun sales last year
column3: discontent over how Black students faculty and staff have been treated for decades at the University of North Carolina is reemerging after the school refused to offer tenure to “1619 Project” investigative journalist Nikole Hannah-Jones
column4: and with record high temperatures and a historic drought officials in the west are raising caution over Fourth of July fireworks.  After the break we move to the Chef’s Table where a trove of classified UK defense papers were found at bus stop in Kent southeast of London
column5: and a migrant farm worker’s death in Southern Italy has spurred officials to ban farm work during the region’s most torrid days through August.  All that and more on West Coast Cookbook & Speakeasy with Chef de Cuisine Justice Putnam.  Bon Appétit!  The Netroots Radio Live Player        The West Coast Cookbook & Speakeasy Podcast Archive ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ (Be sure to check thenekkidtruth's diary Pump NetrootsRadio Throughout Your Entire House and enjoy Netroots Radio in all of it's high fidelity glory!) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Show Music for West Coast Cookbook & Speakeasy is by Frances Livings! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Don't forget to tune in to The Justice Department: Musique sans Frontieres Sundays 8pm to 9pm Pacific.  Special Agent DJ Justice
column6: Radio Host and Program Director for Netroots Radio mans the dials spins the discs warbles the woofers puts a slip in your hip and a trip to your hop. You can listen here to The Justice Department: Musique sans Frontieres PodCast. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Voices and Soul appears on Black Kos Tuesday's Chile
column7: poetry chosen and critiqued by Black Kos Poetry Editor Justice Putnam. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Daily Kos Radio Vintage James Baldwin Labor History Native American Documentaries Majority Report RadioLabor News The Left Show Let's Speak Native with John Kane Democracy Now The David Packman Show In Deep with Angie Coiro The Professional Left with Driftglass & Blue Gal Thom Hartmann The Tim Corrimal Show Jim Hightower Green News Report Irreverent Testimony with Rachel & Travis ACLU Minutes The Best of Katie Speak with Katie Klabusich Breaking Through with Mom's Rising The BradCast Eclectic Mixes by Spc Agnt DJ Justice Nicole Sandler The Zero Hour with RJ Eskow The Mike Malloy Show Health Science & History Specials your Netroots Radio Favorites... and so much more on right now! ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  “Do you smell that?” she asked as we drove through Reims past the headquarters of the National Front on our way to La Tranche sur Mer. “I don’t know” I said flatly “what is it?” “It smells like… ” she sniffed in a haughty Parisian disdain “it smells like fascism.” I knew then I was in love with her. I knew it truly.  – Justice Putnam “My Little French Honeymoon”  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  Answer: Tribal Alliances Heart-felt Convictions Passionate Reason Random Abandon Sustainable Civility and a kiss
column8: to comfort the sad and the mad Ones
column9: the Ones roaming the International section of the American Supermarket at night
column10: or roaming the neglected streets looking for an angry malaprop to sink their teeth into
column11: the Ones who seek without seeking and learn as much as they teach
column12: the Ones who embrace and kiss and embrace again
column13: the Ones who sing the song of the city and the ballads of the forest
column14: the Ones who chant the rhythm of the sea and hum the melody of the desert
